required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Atomoxetine Versus Placebo in Children With Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Efficacy and Safety Comparison of Fixed-Dose Ranges of Atomoxetine Hydrochloride in Child Outpatients With Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: Atomoxetine versus placebo in Children with Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)

primary_outcome.measure: Change of total score on ADHD RS-IV-JParent Version: Investigation-Administered and Scored

secondary_outcome.measure: Relationship between atomoxetine doses and both efficacy and safety variables
Plasma concentration of atomoxetine and its metabolites
Changes on ADHD RS-IV-J-School Version score

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients are diagnosed with ADHD
- Patients must be able to swallow capsules
- Patients must be of normal intelligence
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who weigh less than 15 kg or more than 75 kg
- Patients with organic brain disease (for example, dementia or traumatic brain injury residual)
